column5: Well the Detroit River is starting to heat up and limits of walleyes are coming to the boats. Depsite the wind, rain and waves the walleye fishing is picking up after a slow start mainly because of the weather. N and E winds have kept the Ont side of the DR muddy and little to no fishing has taken place on our side this spring. Walleyes are being caught be jiggers using 1/2-3/4 oz jigs, most using chartruese with a variety of plastic minnows or worms (Gulp and FINS) seem to be favourites around here. Most of the action is happening in the mid river section across from Lasalle Ont. Anglers are fishing channel edges in 12-30 fow keeping their baits as vertical as possible. Here are a few from today.
Very nice catch    can't wait for the opener up here
hungry???  19 walleye...   hope there was a group of you...  you can get fat eating that much fish and chips...lol
Thanks for the update Bob. I was down there last weekend but elected not to try the river due to the water conditions. Headed out for Crappie insted.
Actually 20 lol walleyes a 4 man Michigan limit. Too late for the fat part!
Good stuff Bob....do you pay much attention to the St. Clair river?  I'm thinking it should be time to head down there and start tossing grubs from shore in the evening....?
Nice going Bob....gawd i hate this time of year....i have to wait a whole 3 weeks before i can even begin dreaming of a canadian tailgate party....lol.
nice catch of yummy erie eyes !!!  well done cheers !!!
